column4: event_description

column1: Date in which the entry was submitted to qualtrics (pacific standard time)
column4: description of the event
On January 24, 2020 in Israel, it was announced that "due to the Coronavirus outbreak, the Ministry of Health recommends avoiding nonessential travel to Wuhan, China."

On January 26, 2020, in Israel: "The The Ministry stresses that whoever arrived from China and does not exhibit any symptoms of the disease does not need to get tested. In case that a respiratory disease (fever and coughing) appears during travel to China or within 14 days after the last stay in China: Refer to your treating physician at the HMO or go to the emergency room as soon as possible. Call in advance and notify emergency room staff that the patient suffers from respiratory disease and that the patient stayed in China, before arriving at the hospital or the offices of your treating physician at the HMO. Avoid traveling in public transportation. Until tested by a physician, keep your mouth and nose covered by a surgical mask or by another available cloth. Upon entering the clinic or the emergency room, promptly report the symptoms of the disease to the receptionist or the nurse on duty, and disclose the possible connection to a stay in China about 14 days before the appearance of the symptoms."

On January 26, 2020, authorities in Israel claim: "Following an additional situation evaluation in the Ministry of Health today on the coronavirus, it was decided to urge the public to avoid unnecessary travel to China. "
In Israel, on January 27, 2020, "the Minister of Health, Yaakov Litzman, signed the People's Health Ordinance Decree to expand the Ministry's powers to deal with the Coronavirus."

In Israel, on January 29, 2020, "the Ministry of Health advised the Popoulation and Immigration Authority to close off any sea and land points of entry (including Allenby Checkpoint) to non-Israelis who had stayed in China 14 days prior to entry to Israel."

In Israel on February 2, 2020, the "an official quarantine order [was] signed by the Ministry of Health Director Generals [that] sanctions home quarantine to any person who stayed in China as well as for anyone who have been in contact with a confirmed coronavirus patient."

In Israel, on February 3, 2020, "the Ministry of Health has contacted mobile phone companies to send a text message in Hebrew and English to all incoming travelers upon arrival to Israel explaining the Ministry of Health's measures regarding the coronavirus."
In Israel, on February 3, 2020, "the Ministry of Health shall issue a valid sickness certificate to anyone who is legally required to remain quarantined for the duration of the quarantine period."

On February 7, 2020, in Israel "the Ministry of Health expands its definition of suspected exposure to Coronavirus for purposes of performing medical tests on people returning from additional countries and regions. Any person who [...] stayed in one of the following countries or regions: China, Hong Kong, Thailand, Japan, Singapore, South Korea or Macau in the 14 days preceding the appearance of symptoms described below [...] should approach the nearest clinic or hospital."

In Israel, on February 7, 2020 "the Ministry of Health expands its definition of suspected exposure to Coronavirus for purposes of performing medical tests on people returning from additional countries and regions. The new definition is as follows:Any person [that] came in direct contact with a verified patient and exhibiting one or more of the following symptoms - fever over 38 degrees, coughing, difficulty breathing or any other respiratory symptom - should approach the nearest clinic or hospital."

The Ministry of Health expands its definition of suspected exposure to Coronavirus for purposes of performing medical tests on people returning from additional countries and regions. [...] Any person [that] stayed in one of the following countries or regions: China, Hong Kong, Thailand, Japan, Singapore, South Korea or Macau in the 14 days preceding the appearance of symptoms fever over 38 degrees, coughing, difficulty breathing or any other respiratory symptom should approach the nearest clinic or hospital.

On February 9, 2020, the Israeli "Minister of Health Yaakov Litzman [...] recommends reconsidering the necessity of traveling to the following destinations: Thailand, Japan, Hong Kong, Singapore, Macau, South Korea, Taiwan. In addition to the travel warning issued for China."
On February 10, 2020, in Israel, the Ministry of Health "stresses that it has created an official, task-specific website on the issue of the Coronavirus."

On February 11, 2020, it is announced in Israel: "The Ministry's working assumption is that the coronavirus will reach Israel, and the healthcare system continues to prepare for this scenario. The Ministry of Health has increased the capacity of screening tests at the central laboratory in Tel Hashomer, and in the next few days, will prepare 3 additional laboratories to run coronavirus screening tests and verify its possible presence at Soroka, Hadassah and Rambam medicl centers."

In Israel, on February 16, 2020, it was announced: "Due to an increase in the number of confirmed coronavirus cases in locations adjacent to China's mainland ‰ÛÒ the Ministry of Health has expanded the home quarantine order to include people returning from four more countries and regions, in addition to China's mainland: Thailand, Hong Kong (China), Singapore, Macau (China). This decision applies to people who entered Israel since 16.2.2020. Quarantine is not required of anyone who has been in these places for a connecting flight only."

On February 17, 2020, it is announced that "the State of Israel is preparing to bring back its citizens who were on board the Diamond Princess ship in Japan under protective quarantine conditions. The Minister of Health, Ya‰Ûªakov Litzman, and the Director General of the Ministry of Health, Mr. Moshe Bar Siman Tov, instructed the Shiba Medical Center to prepare to receive the Israelis upon their arrival in Israel. The Shiba Medical Center is preparing to receive the Israelis in a separate unit manned by a designated team specifically assigned to this task. During their stay at the designated unit, the Shiba Medical Center will continue its regular activity with complete separation ‰ÛÒ both physical and infrastructural ‰ÛÒ from the quarantine area."
In Israel, on February 18, 2020, it is declared that "the Ministry of Health took action to allocate a ward in every general hospital as a designated ward for possible coronavirus patients."

On February 20, 2020, in Israel it was published that "the Ministry of Health wishes to clarify that the violation of the quarantine order may result in criminal charges, with a penalty of up to 7 years imprisonment if the violation was intentional, and up to 3 years imprisonment if it was negligence. This act constitutes "a potentially disease spreading act" in accordance with Article 218 of the penal code, as well as a violation of Article 287, "Violation of a Legal Order." Whoever wishes to report a violation of the home quarantine order may do so through the Ministry of Health's task-specific Coronavirus information website."

On February 22, 2020, it was announced that "following a report received from South Korea regarding 9 tourists from a group that recently stayed in Israel between 8.2.2020 ‰ÛÒ 15.2.2020 and subsequently identified as coronavirus patients upon returning to South Korea. The Ministry of Health wishes to instruct the Israeli public as follows: 1. Anyone who came in close contact (at a distance of less than two meters and for at least 15 minutes) with members of this group according to the dates and location detailed below, is requested to enter home quarantine for a duration of 14 days since last date of contact with the group and report this at the Ministry of Health's website or Kol Habriut Hotline, *5400.  Furthermore, should you develop the symptoms of the disease (fever over 38, coughing, or other respiratory symptoms) seek medical assistance in accordance with the Ministry of Health's instructions on the website, all the while calling ahead of time and following the Ministry's guidelines.2. Anyone who was in the same locations at the same time detailed below as the group *but without close contact* is not required to enter home quarantine but is asked to remain vigilant to the symptoms of the disease (fever over 38, coughing or other respiratory symptoms)."

On February 2, 2020, in Israel it was announced that "any individual who visited South Korea or Japan in the last 14 days must remain in a 14-day home quarantine counting from the latest date he/she left these places, in addition to travelers from China, Hong Kong, Macau, Singapore, and Thailand."

On February 23, 2020, the Ministry of Health of Israel announced: "Starting Monday morning, entry will be denied of any person who is not an Israeli resident or citizen and who stayed in South Korea and Japan in the 14 days before arrival in Israel."

In Israel, on February 23, 2020, it was claimed that "anyone who has visited Taiwan, Italy, or Australia in the last 14 days and develops symptoms of illness, needs to follow the Ministry's guidance and get tested."

On February 23, 2020, in Israel: "As a consequence of the discussion and assessment held today February 23, 2020 that was led by the Prime Minister concerning the outbreak of the novel coronavirus, the Ministry of Health advised the Ministry of Education to suspend school delegations to Poland."

The government has issued a travel warning to Italy in view of the morbidity there. The Ministry of Health recommends all Israeli residents avoid travel to Italy. [...]  the Ministry of Health advises the general public to consider all nonessential travel, regardless whether a certain destination is specified in the Home Quarantine Decree."
On February 26, 2020, in Israel: "The Ministry of Health issued a Decree that all travelers from Italy in the last 14 days must be placed under a 14-day home quarantine."

In Israel, on February 26, 2020 the Ministry of Health declares: "The public is advised to avoid travel to international conferences, conventions or any other congregate settings, including travel to religious events, where foreign nationals assemble. Avoid organizing international conferences in Israel. Elaborate guidance will be released in the Ministry of Health Website."

In Israel on February 27, 2020: "The Ministry of Health discloses that ELAL flight LY382 from Italy, which landed in Israel on February 23 2020 16:10, had onboard a confirmed COVID-19 patient.All passengers must be directly placed under home quarantine for 14 days from the date of landing and send a questionnaire to the Ministry of Health or call the Ministry of Health Hotline at *5400."

In Israel, on February 28, 2020: "The Ministry of Health announces that the epidemiologic investigation has ended. The findings specifiy the places the patient visited and at that times:El Al flight number LY381 on 21.2.20 departing from Israel at 06:00El Al flight Iy 382 landed in Israel on 23.2.20 at 16:10Sunday 23.2 "The Red Pirate" store, Or Yehuda from 18:00 to 22:00Monday 24.2 "The Red Pirate" store, Or Yehuda from 08:30 - 24:00Tuesday 25.2 "The Red Pirate" store, Or Yehuda 08:30 - 24:00Monday, February 24, at the "Irus" Synagogue on Noga Street, Irus, from 06:00-07:00Any person who visited these places and had close contact - being less than 2 meters for 15 minutes or more - of the patient, must be placed under 14-day home quarantine and send a questionnaire to the Ministry of Health or the Health Ministry Hotline *5400."

On February 28, 2020, in Israel, it was announced that "a passenger [that tested positive for Coronavirus] arrived on commercial Turkish Airline flight TK53 from Tokyo to Istanbul, and on flight TK84 from Istanbul to Tel Aviv that landed in Israel at 08:55.All passengers who were onboard the flight that landed this morning and who were on the same flight as this person must enter home quarantine immediately for 14 days, and report this at the Ministry of Health's website or at Kol Habriut Hotline at *5400."

In Israel, on March 4, 2020: ‰ÛÜ"Israelis citizens who left France, Germany, Switzerland, Spain and Austria must be placed under a 14-day home quarantine. This requirement is retroactive, meaning it is valid from the date of departure from these locations."
Israel denies entry to foreign nationals from France, Germany, Switzerland, Spain and Austria on March 4, 2020, unless they prove the ability to be placed under home quarantine.

On March 4, 2020, in Israel: "‰ÛÜIsraelis citizens who left France, Germany, Switzerland, Spain and Austria must be placed under a 14-day home quarantine. This requirement is retroactive, meaning it is valid from the date of departure from these locations."
On March 4, 2020, it was announced that "international conferences in Israel are forbidden".
It is announced in Israel on March 4, 2020 that "Israeli residents returning from conferences outside of the country must be placed under a 14-day home quarantine."
In Israel on March 4, 2020: "Healthcare system employees are not permitted to travel abroad."
In Israel, on March 4, 2020: "All large public events / mass gatherings of more than 5,000 people are not permitted."
On March 4, 2020, it was declared: "Travelers from Iran, Iraq, Syria and Lebanon (in the last 14 days) will be denied entry to Israel."

On March 4, 2020, it is announced:"The recommendation for older adults over 60, and for people with chronic diseases such as heart conditions, diabetes, hypertension, respiratory diseases or immunosuppression, is to avoid gatherings, contact with international travelers, contact with sick people, and contact with people suspected of a coronavirus infection."
In Israel, on March 4, 2020: "The Ministry of Health recommends to practice strict hygiene and avoid shaking hands."

In Israel, on March 4, 2020: "The Ministry of Health, in cooperation with Belong Life Company, launched today an application that provides information and support regarding the Coronavirus called 'CoronApp.'"

In Israel, on March 9, 2020, it is announced: "Effective today, March 9th, 2020 at 20:00, any Israeli resident returning from any destination will be required to remain in home isolation for 14 days from the date of his or her return."
In Israel, on March 9, 2020: "Non-residents of Israel will only be allowed entry if they have proven capacity to remain in home isolation in accordance with the Ministry of Health guidelines."

In Israel, on March 9, 2020: "Regarding tourists currently in Israel, they will be given time to leave Israel in an orderly fashion. Until the date of their departure, they will be obliged to adhere to 5 rules: Upon the onset of symptoms ‰ÛÒ Call Magen David Adom immediately (101), maintain strict hygiene, avoid gatherings, it will not be possible to return to Israel after departing to neighboring countries, keep a diary of your activities and movements while in Israel."
In Israel, on March 2, 2020: "Gatherings of over 2,000 people are not permitted."
In Israel, on March 10, 2020: "Visits to hospitals and to facilities for the elderly are to be avoided."
The Israeli Ministry of Health, on March 11, 2020: "We urge all citizens and residents of Israel and those staying in Israel (tourists) to avoid entering the Palestinian Authority territories."
On March 11, 2020 the Israeli Ministry of Health clarifies: "Avoid gatherings over 2,000 people. This provision applies to all types of gatherings, including those religious in nature."

In Israel, on March 11, 2020: "Avoid gatherings of people in one space. If gatherings are held ‰ÛÒ they should be as limited as possible, and no more than 100 people. [...] Sports events will be held without spectators."
In Israel, on March 11, 2020: "Health staff responsible for treating patients ‰ÛÒ may gather only for work purposes, and in groups not over 15 people."

On March 13, 2020: "A specially formed force, composed of Israeli police and health inspectors, continues to carry out visits to ensure the isolation. The Israeli police will continue increased visible and covert activity with the aim of assisting the Ministry of Health in the enforcement effort. The Israeli police will act in accordance with the policies and guidelines against the violators to prevent the spread of the coronavirus in Israel."

In Israel on March 11, 2020, it was announced: "Responsibilities of stores, malls and shopping centers ‰ÛÒto ensure no crowding and regulate occupancy, at any given moment, to avoid crowding and take care to maintain a reasonable distance between people."

On March 15, 2020 in Israel: "All educational establishments will cease activity, regardless of the number of children, this includes special education programs, boarding schools, daycare centers, pre-nursery playgroups (mishpachtonim), youth camps, summer day camps (kaytanot) and after-school daycare centers (tzaharonim) "

Israel declares on March 15, 2020 that all malls, clubs, bars, pubs, and food establishments, gyms, swimming pools, water parks, zoos, the Safari, petting zoos, cinemas, theaters, and other cultural establishments etc. will be closed.
In Israel, on March 15, 2020 it is announced: "Any gathering of more than 10 people is forbidden."
In Israel on March 19, 2020 a cooperation between the Ministry of Health and Defense Agencies, especially with the Mossad, during Coronavirus Event was announced.
In Israel on March 19, 2020 information was published about a "joint operation of Israel Police and [the] Ministry of Health Inspection Team".

In Israel, on March 19, 2020 new rules of conduct were established to create "social distance": "Keep at least 2 meters between people as much as possible.Travel by private car- up to 2 travelers in the same vehicle. As far as service providers are concerned, the regulations state that in a delivery service to a place of residence, the shipment will be placed near and outside the entrance, and that essential repair services can be carried out in a residence."

On March 19, 2020, new "regulations [...] to reduce the contact between the population in the State of Israel"are announced: - Only in certain cases, a person may exit a place of residence to the public space (getting to and from work, acquiring and purchasing essential foods, medicines, medical treatment, going out for a short time only and nearby, alone or exclusively with members of the same household, going out for a religious ceremony etc.) - Rules of conduct are established aimed at creating "social distance": Keep at least 2 meters between people, - Any retail, recreation and leisure activities are prohibited (with few exceptions)
On March 20, 2020, in Israel: "The Ministry of Health Approved Local Production of Applicators".

In Israel, on March 22, 2020, the Ministry of Health launches "app that allows the identification of contacts between diagnosed patients and people who came in contact with them in the 14 days prior to the patient's diagnosis of the Coronavirus".

In Israel, on March 23, 2020 the president and heads of authorities joined a solidarity campaign with the Ministry of Health‰Ûªs guidelines. Several companies and artists were included in the campaign: "If we get out of home - we are not going to get out of it‰Û�.

The Israeli Government approved new, extended emergency regulations aimed at creating "social distance" on March 25, 2020 that include inter alia:- the reduction of public transport services to around 25%- the employer is obligated to measure body temperature at the entrance to the workplace - the enforcement of regulations by the police
